title: Shirahoshi's Silence Enabled Hody's Rise to Power
theoryText: By not revealing that Hody Jones assassinated Queen Otohime, Shirahoshi's silence - while honoring her mother's wish to avoid revenge - inadvertently allowed Hody to amass power and followers in preparation for his eventual coup. If she had exposed him earlier, it could have brought Hody to justice and prevented the war on Fish-Man Island.
author: Various One Piece fans

title: Shyarly's Prophecy Will Be Fulfilled Through Noah
theoryText: Shyarly's prediction that Luffy will destroy Fish-Man Island could be fulfilled when Luffy has to stop the massive Noah ship from crashing into the island. The 'destruction' might be necessary to save the island from Vander Decken's attack, making Luffy both the destroyer and savior simultaneously.

title: Hody Jones Represents Inherited Hatred Without Cause
theoryText: Hody Jones is intentionally written as a villain with no tragic backstory or personal trauma. Unlike Arlong who experienced genuine persecution, Hody simply hates humans because he was raised to hate them. This makes him a representation of how prejudice and hatred can be passed down through generations without any personal justification, creating a cycle of violence based purely on inherited ideology.
